üåü Exciting Achievement Alert! üåü

Hello Connections,

I am thrilled to share a significant milestone in my journey. A few months ago, a friend convinced me to take on a challenging course in design-build for wind turbine competitions at DTU - Technical University of Denmark ( DTU Wind and Energy Systems ) with the motivating words, "If not us, who can?" Today, I am immensely grateful for that decision. üòä

Over the past four months, I've been deeply involved in intense hands-on field engineering tasks. As part of our course objectives, we aimed to participate in the International Small Wind Turbine Competitions (ISWTC) and Racing Aeolus in Holland. I took on the responsibility of DAQ and control for both HAWT and VAWT.

Facing real-time issues, my primary task was to develop an active controller for HAWT and VAWT from scratch. This involved creating, developing, and testing a new variable pitch controller by measuring wind speeds and RPM to find the optimal TSR in the wind tunnel testing facility at Delft University of Technology organized by Hanze University of applied science. For VAWT, I was able to control the cyclic pitch with phase and amplitude pitching operations to find the optimal TSR and explore different possibilities for pitching out the blades. üí°

With unwavering guidance from our professors and incredible team effort, we achieved an electrical Cp of 0.408, and with the cut-in in low wind speed (3 m/s) and executed variable pitching operations to reach the optimal TSR using our active controller. Additionally, our new aerodynamic winglet blades proved to be a game-changer. üöÄ

Our hard work and innovation led us to receive two prestigious international recognitions: 
üèÜ BEST ANNUAL ENERGY PRODUCTION (AEP) AWARD - 2024 for Horizontal Axis Wind Turbine 
üèÜ BEST OVERALL PERFORMANCE AWARD - 2024 for Vertical Axis Wind Turbine

I would like to extend my heartfelt thanks to Robert Mikkelsen , Taeseong Kim , and Mac Gaunaa for their constant guidance. A special thank you to my friend A RAMAKRISHNAN , who encouraged me to take this leap, and to all my fellow teammates for their dedication and support.

üìùEvery Setback is a Setup for a Comeback!üî•

Sometimes life breaks you just to show you what you're made of. 

You don't have to be strong every second. Let yourself pause, breathe,  and unravel if you must. 

Tears aren't weakness. It's shows you're human. 
Rest isn't quitting, it's survival. 
Your worth isn't tied to how much you carry, it's in how gently you choose to heal.

You think you've hit your limit, that you can't take one more thing, and then something else happens, and somehow, you survive it. 
That survival becomes your quiet rebellion.

There‚Äôs something powerful about surviving what you once thought would destroy you. Even if you crawled through it, the fact that you made it through is proof of your strength.

When life setbacks test you, rise with lessons learnt, adjust strategies, grow and and keep pushing on.

No matter your situation in life, always remember that the sun will rise again tomorrow and so you will.

All beginnings come with challenges, but once the operational frameworks and practicalities fall into place, the potential becomes clear: more flexible and efficient maintenance for offshore wind.

It was a learning journey with many firsts ‚Äî and seeing it work in practice makes the vision tangible.

publications.title: Design of Self-sustainable Automatic Water body Monitoring and  Object Sensing Alerter
publications.description: In our world, currently more than 78% of the freshwater get polluted due to several reasons and causes like disposal of waste, and release of inorganic and organic contaminants in the water body. The water bodies like ponds, lakes, and small dams are getting polluted at a faster rate other than groundwater and collected treated water storage. According to a world population study, India is the third most polluted nation in the world (report on 2022). The Self- sustainable Automatic Water body Monitoring and Object Sensing Alerter device, which does the MCA process (Monitors Collects Analyze process) of the data that are sensed from the atmosphere, water sample, and underwater environment via the sensors and camera in the device that floats on the surface of the water body. The device has two main Units namely the Self-sustainable Automatic Water body Monitoring Unit (SAWM) and Analyzing and Alerting Unit (AAU). Based on the collected signals and readings the AAU analyze and compare the data of the water body. Currently, Five to Eight SAWM can be connected to one AAU which is mounted on the shore or boundary land part of the water body or on the water surface. Through this device, the accidental fall of humans or any other obstacles into the water body can be detected, observed and an alert message and siren alter will be triggered via the AAU. The fall and drowning of the human being into the water can be determined via the sensor and for confirmation; the fall of object/person can be confirmed via the pictures and live monitoring setup using the underwater camera mounted on the device. The device is built in neutral buoyancy so that it gets floats on the surface of the water with its load also via this the device can be implemented on any water body and also this increases the ease of portability and adaptability of the device. publications.title: Eye Disease using Image Processing and Artificial Neural Networks
publications.description: Detection of eye pathologies from the database of iris images is taken intodeliberation. The images of disease affected and normal eyes are taken from High Resolution Fundus (HRF) Image Data base and the influence of ocular diseases on iris is determined using areliable Artificial Neural Network (ANN) based recognition scheme. Nearly, 45 samples of iris are acquired using Canon CR-1 fundus camera with a field of view of 45¬∞ when subjected to routine ophthalmology visits and the samples of eye images include healthy eyes, eyes affected by glaucoma, cataract and diabetic retinopathy. These images are then subjected to various image processing techniques like pre-processing for de-noising and feature extraction using wavelet, followed by Feed Forward Neural Network (FFNN) trained with Back Propagation Algorithm (BPA) inference scheme to categorize the normal and diseased eyes. Finally the results for the proposed method is evaluated using performance measures like sensitivity, specificity, accuracy and time take for online diagnosis against the other methods developed various other researchers. It is inferred that the proposed method takes only 2 minutes with efficiency in the range of 98% to 99.9% respectively. Show less

publications.title: Vision based Detection and Categorization of skin lesions using deep learning Neural Networks
publications.description: Melanoma is the deadly form of skin cancer. The melanocyte serves as the cause for the development of a malignant tumor on the skin. The dermatological photographs are used to detect the skin cancer. The objective of this project is to develop a structurized scheme to analyze and evaluate the probabilities of melanoma with the help of a typical user friendly camera. The novelty of this project is that it has a well developed strategy for skin cancer detection using high performance image based machine learning algorithms to execute intensity level adjustment at the preprocessing stage followed by segmentation and feature extraction from the region of interest, the lesion on the skin surface. This method uses images from the open source data base like DermIS and DermQuest. The preprocessing includes filtering and edge detection. For this purpose, convolution is used to remove the noise present followed by extraction of Highly Perceptive Features (HPF) like colour, irregularity, boundaries, shape and diameter. The correlation coefficients play an important role to determine the effectiveness in identifying the skin tumor and serves as a unique measure to identify the distinct input feature set for training the Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) so as to identify the malignant tumor on the skin surface. The Identification Efficiency (IE) is found to be 95% with a sensitivity of 93.3%. Show less

projects.name: Control Architectures in Hybrid Power Plants (HPP) ‚Äì Analyzing the impact of different control flows and delays on system stability and services
projects.description: ‚Ä¢ Modeling utility scale co-located converter based renewable resources (HPP) with energy storage, hierarchical control architecture with dedicated active power dispatch strategy for Grid-following control mode in DIgSILENT PowerFactory. ‚Ä¢ Performed sensitivity analysis on the impact of the internal communication delays, supervisory controller dynamics and boundary limits, which also include BESS supervisory controller dynamics.

projects.name: Modelling of Hybrid Power Plants for ancillary services provision
projects.description: Working in dynamic modelling and implementation of Hybrid Power Plants (HPP) (hybridized offshore wind & onshore PV with BESS and P2X technologies) and HVDC controllers with upscaling RMS and EMT model in Power factory. Performed comprehensive system analysis for active and reactive power control, incorporating ancillary services provision to optimize grid stability, transmission, reliability, and overall performance in the developed power system.

projects.name: Design and implementation of active pitch control for experimental scaled wind turbine
projects.description: Focused on Collective Pitch Control (CPC) and Independent Pitch Control (IPC), leveraging pole placement techniques to optimize performance. Developed linear control systems using real-time data like rotor speed, torque, and aerodynamic loads for scaled experimental wind turbines. Evaluated through modeling, hardware implementation, and detailed performance analysis documented in an individual final report.

projects.name: Reactive Power Support in a Renewable-Dominated Grid (Hybrid) with Limited Conventional Generation
projects.description: Worked in optimizing Q curve for reactive power support in multiple scenarios of renewable dominated grid with limited conventional power plants to ensure voltage stability created by a short-circuit event in Power Factory Software. Interpreted the parameters of PQ controller (dsl) to mitigate transients due to voltage instability caused by the short-circuit event and limiting to the grid code requirements (0.95 p.u.).

projects.name: Effects of Offshore Wind Farms on Marine Life and other stakeholders
projects.description: Offshore wind farms are transforming energy sustainability but raise concerns about impacts on marine life and tidal dynamics. Through interviews with experts and conservation advocates, we‚Äôre exploring the social, economic, and environmental challenges of wind farm development. Our goal is to bridge science and stakeholder perspectives, paving the way for renewable energy to coexist with thriving marine ecosystems.

projects.name: Microgrid/Island grid characterization + VSC Active Front End (AFE) control
projects.description: Performed an experimental implementation of microgrid with synchronous generator, analysis of virtual inertia vs droop control with non-linear pattern of frequency and Investigation of VSC control. Developed an advanced simulation model of microgrid connected to a synchronous machine with bidirectional VSC in MATLAB Simulink with the controller to stabilize frequency using droop control. Reduced the fluctuation of 2-3% in the linear pattern with immediate load displacement by characterization of the synchronous machine & VSC using dSPACE. Show less

projects.name: Optimization of the Power Grid in Bangladesh - Course work design project
projects.description: Designed a stable power grid with existing power source (natural gas) and potential to include renewables (wind & solar) with the power factor of 0.95 and maintaining transmission efficiency and optimizing it using Power factory (DIgSILENT). Optimized the demand to capacity of the source with limited shunt and performed a comparison study on LCOE, Environment & Power loss using seven operational load scenarios through various iterations in MS Excel and MATLAB.
